results.title: The Great Defender cinema slide
results.creator_credit: Thomas Bentley, Associated British Picture Corporation and British Instructional Films
results.credit_line: ACMI has endeavoured to contact the owners of these objects since their deposit in 2015. Unfortunately this has been unsuccessful. We would welcome any information to identify the owners.
results.brief_description: Two glass sheets: one glass only and the other with slide imagery which has a monochromatic emulsion that has then been hand painted with coloured pigments or dye. TEXT on the slide reads: British International Pictures present Matheson Lang Margaret Bannerman. Richard Bird The Great Defender Smashing Sensation - Seething Drama of Unrequited Love.. And the Law Courts! Released by British Empire Films Ltd Not suitable for general exhibition. Coming It looks as if handwritten text has worn away as there are very faint black marks remaining.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Thomas Bentley, Associated British Picture Corporation and British Instructional Films
results.description: Two glass sheets: one glass only and the other with slide imagery which has a monochromatic emulsion that has then been hand painted with coloured pigments or dye. results.title: Orchids to You cinema slide
results.creator_credit: William A. Seiter and Fox Film Corporation
results.credit_line: ACMI has endeavoured to contact the owners of these objects since their deposit in 2015. Unfortunately this has been unsuccessful. We would welcome any information to identify the owners.
results.brief_description: Two glass sheets: one glass only and the other with slide imagery which has a monochromatic emulsion that has then been hand painted with coloured pigments or dye. TEXT on the slide reads: John Boles Jean Muir “Orchids to You!” He learned about women from her flowers! Not suitable for general exhibition The two sheets of glass are held together using Gunn’s Slide branded tape: Gunn’s Slide, 9 Collins Place Melb. Cent. 2736,

results.title: The Gay Divorcee cinema slide
results.creator_credit: Mark Sandrich and RKO Radio Pictures
results.credit_line: ACMI has endeavoured to contact the owners of these objects since their deposit in 2015. Unfortunately this has been unsuccessful. We would welcome any information to identify the owners.
results.brief_description: Two glass sheets: one glass only and the other with slide imagery which has a monochromatic emulsion that has then been hand painted with coloured pigments or dye. TEXT on the slide reads: The original would have read in it’s entirety: You are now listening to the Theme Songs of The Gay Divorcee Starring: Fred Astaire Ginger Rogers an R.K.O Radio Picture

results.title: Evensong cinema slide
results.creator_credit: Victor Saville and Gaumont British Picture Corporation
results.credit_line: ACMI has endeavoured to contact the owners of these objects since their deposit in 2015. Unfortunately this has been unsuccessful. We would welcome any information to identify the owners.
results.brief_description:
Two glass sheets: one glass only and the other with slide imagery which has a monochromatic emulsion that has then been hand painted with coloured pigments or dye.
TEXT on the slide reads: Evelyn Laye in Evensong with Fritz Kortner Alice Delysia
The two sheets of glass are held together using Gunn’s Slide branded tape: Gunn’s Slide, 9 Collins Place Melb. Cent. 2736.
On the clear glass slide there are remnants of handwritten detail which has nearly all worn off. It possibly says: STARTS..
results.creator_credit_for_label: Victor Saville and Gaumont British Picture Corporation

results.title: Emergency Call cinema slide
results.creator_credit: Edward Cahn and RKO Radio Pictures
results.credit_line: ACMI has endeavoured to contact the owners of these objects since their deposit in 2015. Unfortunately this has been unsuccessful. We would welcome any information to identify the owners.
results.brief_description: Slide features imagery with a monochromatic emulsion that has then been hand painted with coloured pigments or dye. TEXT on the slide reads: Radio Pictures presents Bill Boyd with William Gargen Wynne Gibson in Emergency Call A spell-binding drama! Hurricane Speed! Heart-burning Romance! A Radio Picture Not suitable for General Exhibition

results.title: British Agent cinema slide
results.creator_credit: Michael Curtiz and Warner Brothers First National Productions
results.credit_line: ACMI has endeavoured to contact the owners of these objects since their deposit in 2015. Unfortunately this has been unsuccessful. We would welcome any information to identify the owners.
results.brief_description:
Two glass sheets: one glass only and the other with slide imagery which has a monochromatic emulsion that has then been hand painted with coloured pigments or dye. Kay Francis Lesley Francis
It was said to be: “Too intimate to be printed!” “Too daring to be filmed!” British Agent Gunn Slide Not suitable for general exhibition On the front glass slide there is worn away hand writing: Monday matinee
results.creator_credit_for_label: Michael Curtiz and Warner Brothers First National Productions

results.title: Atlantic Adventure cinema slide
results.creator_credit: Albert S. Rogell and Columbia Pictures
results.credit_line: ACMI has used best endeavours to remain in contact with the owners of these objects since their deposit with ACMI in 2015. Unfortunately this has been unsuccessful and ACMI would welcome any information to assist identify a current contact for their ownership.
results.brief_description: Two glass sheets: one glass only and the other with slide imagery which has a monochromatic emulsion that has then been hand painted with coloured pigments or dye. TEXT on the slide reads: Nancy Carroll Lloyd Nolan Harry Langdon in Atlantic Adventure Not suitable for General Exhibition. A Columbia production There is worn away black handwriting on the plain glass slide which says: Next Wed, Thurs, Fri
